meanings.definition: To ask for or obtain something to which one is not strictly entitled
meanings.sent1: He kept cadging for more candy even though he had already eaten his share.
meanings.sent2: She was always cadging pencils from her classmates because she kept losing hers.
meanings.sent3: The little boy tried cadging a second cookie from his mom by giving her a big hug.
meanings.sent4: The clever raccoon was skilled at cadging food from unsuspecting campers.
meanings.sent5: The beggar was known for cadging coins from passersby with his sad story.

meanings.definition: To obtain by imposing on another's generosity or friendship
meanings.sent1: He was cadging a ride to the party from his friend who had a car.
meanings.sent2: She managed to cadge an invitation to the exclusive event by sweet-talking the organizer.
meanings.sent3: The cat was expert at cadging extra treats from the neighbors with its cute meows.
meanings.sent4: The charming salesman could cadge a sale out of even the most reluctant customer.
meanings.sent5: The sly fox was always cadging food from the other animals in the forest.
